title: When will your child be offered vaccines?
description: Here is an overview of when your child will be offered vaccines as part of the Childhood Immunisation Programme.
cleaned_text: When will your child be offered vaccines? Article| Updated Here is an overview of when your child will be offered vaccines as part of the Childhood Immunisation Programme. 6 weeks - Vaccine against [rotavirus](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-rotavirus/) - Vaccine against [tuberculosis (BCG)](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-tuberculosis/); if in a risk group Premature babies born before the 32nd week of pregnancy are recommended an extra dose of [vaccine against diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, poliomyelitis, Hib-infection and hepatitis B.](/en/publ/information-letters/vaksine-mot-difteri-stivkrampe-kikhoste-poliomyelitt-hib-infeksjon-og-hepat/) 3 months - Vaccine against [rotavirus](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-rotavirus/) - Vaccine against [diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, poliomyelitis, Hib-infection and hepatitis B](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/Vaccine-against-diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-poliomyelitis-Hib-infection-hepatitisB/) - Vaccine against [pneumococcal disease](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-pneumococcal-disease/) [Full screen mode available on Vimeo.com](https://vimeo.com/344314749). 5 months - Vaccine against [diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, poliomyelitis, Hib-infection and hepatitis B](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/Vaccine-against-diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-poliomyelitis-Hib-infection-hepatitisB/) - Vaccine against [pneumococcal disease](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-pneumococcal-disease/) [Full screen mode available at Vimeo.com](https://vimeo.com/351552238). 12 months - Vaccine against [diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, poliomyelitis, Hib-infection and hepatitis B](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/Vaccine-against-diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-poliomyelitis-Hib-infection-hepatitisB/) - Vaccine against [pneumococcal disease](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-pneumococcal-disease/) [Full screen mode available at Vimeo.com](https://vimeo.com/351552238). 15 months - Vaccine against [measles, mumps and rubella (MMR)](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-measles-mumps-rubella/) 2nd grade (7-years-old) - Vaccine against [diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough and poliomyelitis](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/Vaccine-against-diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-poliomyelitis/) 6th grade (11-years-old) - Vaccine against [measles, mumps and rubella (MMR)](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-measles-mumps-rubella/) (12-years-old) [HPV (human papilloma virus)](/en/va/childhood-immunisation-programme/vaccines-in-CIP/vaccine-against-hpv-human-papilloma-virus/). 10th grade (15-years-old) -
